title: Newer version of Matthew Carter's Elephant.
content:
Hello.

Just wondering if anyone knows of a newer / better version of Elephant / Big Figgins. I am looking for a stylized Bodoni much like it, but with nice kerning pairs, and a little bit ’updated’.

Thanks.

comments.content:
Hello there:

I own Big Figgins and it has many kerning pairs. As I have used it more and more I have come to notice there is not a single curve out of place—I happen to think it’s perfectly harmonious.

There are not too many Bodoni/Figgins interpretations that are as good. The only one I can think of is not released just yet:

[http://www.christianschwartz.com/brunel.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161634/http:/www.christianschwartz.com/brunel.shtml "http://www.christianschwartz.com/brunel.shtml")

Also here is a script I use to test the kerning in the fonts I own—here; set in Big Figgins Roman:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161634im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/figgins_4994.png)

Mikey :-)

Hello Mikey.

Yes, I am sure Big Figgins is lovely. The version I have in my possession is Elephant and Elephant Italic. Elephant Italic has some really awkward moments. Do you know where I can purchase Big Figgins? I can’t seem to find it anywhere.

Thanks!

Carl

Hello:

Contact Carter&Cone (Matthew Carter’s foundry) via email or telephone:

[http://www.carterandcone.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080924161634/http:/www.carterandcone.com/ "http://www.carterandcone.com")

Ask for Big Figgins pricing.

Mikey :-)

PS... Big Figgins also has three styles roman, italic, and an open face.
